website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive camera stabilizer that's an easy-to-use unit perfect for shooting wobble-free video streams.
pros: Works perfectly with a smartphone camera, as the frame makes it much easier to hold steady with 2 hands than trying to hold the smartphone by itself
You also can mount other equipment to the stabilizer, such as extra lights or a standalone microphone, to enhance your video shooting
cons: Clamp may struggle to hold some thin smartphones tightly inside the frame

customer_reviews.title: Decent Smartphone Camera Rig
customer_reviews.text: I’m very satisfied this smartphone camera rig. Barely fit with Samsung Galaxy Note 8 smartphone case, much easier without the case and filming so better. Can’t wait making the first movie...
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Works great with an iPhone 8 Plus without case. Works with case but not as good due to “V” shape of rubber pads. Holds so secure that a case is unnecessary. I use with a Takstar SGC-598 mic and mount to a tripod. I used a level to check the holder and the iPhone built in level to verify. I was pleasantly surprised to see the phone mounted perfectly level in the holder. Super sturdy and multiple cold shoe mounts allow you to mount the mic over the camera lense so you are looking and talking to the same location. Makes a nice visual cue to make sure you are looking at the lense.
customer_reviews.author: Matigras

customer_reviews.title: Just get it! Perfect for smartphone, microphone, light etc.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect. There are plenty of mounts for microphone, light, etc and the screw holes allow easy horizontal or vertical attachment to a tripod or selfie stick. I use an iphone 7 plus with an attachable wide angle lens and microphone and it works great for that. Go for the u Rig Pro because you never know when you might need the extra mounts and it's comfortable to hold but still light weight for use with one hand. Super pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan - Prime Autotainment

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is great little set up for the price. It is plastic as I was expecting for the price, but it seems sturdy enough. I have used it to put a wireless receiver and light on it and it held up fine. I like the fact there is a tripod mount on the side so if you choose to use it in portrait mode (for Facebook live) you have that option. This does make it a lot easier to shoot video with two hands in a more natural position rather than fumble around the phone and worry about getting your fingers in the shot. Highly recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Gattorna

customer_reviews.title: Avoid for iPhone 11 wide angle
customer_reviews.text: I really was hoping this rig would work, but if you are using any case, other than the most thin perhaps, you will immediately encounter problems. Further, if you want to use an iPhone 11 with the wide angle lens you won't be able to use the furry mouse cover on a Rode microphone on wide angle mode...for video you *may* be able to find a way to angle things just right where the mic cover doesn't bounce into frame, but on photo mode it is impossible (even without a case).
customer_reviews.author: Xipper

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for our church services to do live recording. It’s made nicely, looks, sturdy. Once added to the tripod it’s so rigged that we had to place wedges to make it set straight. The phone holder is so strong you have a time opening the grips to get your phone inside. Once inside it will certainly not fall out. I’m certain this will loosen up after some use. Over all I may have gotten a bad one but it’s not worth repacking to return, you get what you pay for. Yet if the fix the issues this indeed would be a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: DChamp

customer_reviews.title: Solid rig! Works for vertical and horizontal video
customer_reviews.text: Nice phone camera rig! I really like that there’s multiple threads on all sides to allow mounting on a tripod/monopod for vertical and horizontal video. The clamp is nice and keeps the phone secure, Rode microphone threads right on to the cold shoe mount for a fully functional mobile or static camera rig!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Expected more from the ratings it got.
customer_reviews.text: It did help with stability however in the reviews it stated my plus size iPhone would fit with a protective otterbox defender...it did not. Second, the cold shoe attachment points have too thin of flanges so my shotgun mic went past the useable threads without cobbling up a shim to correct it. It seemed like it had slight damage around one of the flanges from when it was removed from the mold...? I’ll call this a quality control issue.
customer_reviews.author: Neuxstone

customer_reviews.title: MUCH better price for my needs than The Beast
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional photographer/video maker...but I am an artist and must take lots of pictures of my paintings for websites, entries, etc. I saw someone else using The Beast and looked into it: but I was not willing to spend $200 to help me hold the iPhone easier. This is SO easy to use, and my iPhone 7 Plus WITH a thin case fits easily into the clamp. Haven't tried a tripod or attachments (and doubt I ever will), but if all you need is something to hold your phone easier to take steady still shots, this works well.
customer_reviews.author: Elizeon

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile mount
customer_reviews.text: This thing can work all kinds of ways and with all kinds of equipment. You can mount it on your tripod in landscape or portrait. It has 5 mounts on top, 2 screw-in and 3 cold shoe. The phone mount can work with just about any width of phone, from an old iphone to the toast-sized phones of today and it has nice soft rubber to meet with the phone. It's very comfortable to hold with a good feeling of steadiness. Like holding a steering wheel. All in all, I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hancox

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Rig for your smartphone
customer_reviews.text: Been looking to try and use my iphone 11 pro max as a camera that I can hook a mic and light up too, this works great and can be mounted to a tripod Pros Lightweight 3 hot shoe mounts Can shoot Vertically or horizontally 2 tripod mounts Cons: It's on the larger side of a rig but works well I recommend it if you are looking for a rig for your smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: Rico10x

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, lightweight, versatile, little beauty!
customer_reviews.text: The tensioning knob backed off and was lost on trail. Mind you, this was after almost 200 miles of grueling, wilderness trail. There was still enough tension to hold my iPhone 7 in place as long as I wasn’t doing anything too crazy. It’s lightweight, versatile. Hang around my neck with a strap I use to stabilize the motion, on top of a myriad of tripods and gimbals. It just works! I bought another one as soon as I returned from my trip. ( yes, two verified purchases from Amazon with this product. Way more valuable to me then the inexpensive price of this little star. ( keep an eye on that tension knob though!)
customer_reviews.author: Biff Schweizer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad. Could be improved in one way, but does what you want it too.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy with this product. Being able to add things to make the phone record videos better is nice. I added a mic to the top and the videos have been great. My only issue would be the way the clamp works. It is hard to remove your phone when you want to do something else with it and you lose access to some of your buttons since the clamp is almost up against the bottom of the frame. Other than that, pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Novis

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This rig really worth the price I paid. For less than $16.00 it worth every penny. Sturdy enough for holding my phone and it has cold shoes for lightings and mic. I can highly recommend this for anyone who wants a video rig for shooting videos on your phone. It can not replace your selfie stick as this one is for different purpose. I don’t regret buying this.
customer_reviews.author: A.N.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Since teaching kids has change from classroom to online, I had arrange my own scenario to bring different ways of learning to my different class and age groups. My Samsung note 9 fit perfectly to this ring. I had to remove the thin cover, but is ok, the phone was so tight that I will never fall. I feel confident in carrying my phone around. Not needs to worry about an slip accident. You can add different light or audio accessories to it.
customer_reviews.author: Zuleima Esq

customer_reviews.title: Great for social media and cell phone recordings
customer_reviews.text: Use on a couple work projects. Overall great rig and survived being tossed around during flights. The shoe mounts are excellent. Just good to note that your phone PLUS this rig will be pretty substantial on any tripod. Highly suggest getting a sturdy tripod instead of the very basic ones due to the combined weight on the universal mount points!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Wong

customer_reviews.title: I love this video rig for shooting Facebook Live videos in the field.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little video rig for using to shoot Facebook Live Videos for field events we do. They have room for our Sennheiser and Sony mic receivers, an led light, Rode boom mic and more. Great little rig. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't have enough good things to say about this. As a small time YouTube content creator, this has totally changed the game for me. It's very stable on the tripod even with accessories. It's also very stable if you're doing B-roll by hand. If for some reason I break this one, I wouldn't have any hesitation buying a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: AWP99

customer_reviews.title: The perfect setup for small or new youtubers!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot afford to spend over $700 on a fancy 4K DSLR right now so I am using my Note 9 which has a decent camera to record youtube videos. This is very easy to setup and has lots of mounting options so you can use it with tons of attachments or tripods. I highly recommend this if you are a small content creator and have a decent smartphone to make videos.
customer_reviews.author: Dad's Dojo

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for your Buck!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using this rig. I like the way my pho e can be clamped in without any need to balance, and the actual mechanism secures the phone without being spring loaded, which makes it easy to load. The additional mounting points allow me to connect my wireless lav mix with room for a light. For the money you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Light-Zone

customer_reviews.title: Makes you look like a pro!!!
customer_reviews.text: I see why this video read got such a high rating. When I tell you I feel like such a professional content creator when I’m using it. I love how it has three horseshoe slots at the very top and I love how I can slide in my lights and a microphone into the slot with ease. I feel the case is sturdy and strong and I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T.I.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry, Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: During my last trip to Germany I used the Ulanzi and a 3 axis gimbal to film my tour of the Reichstag Building. Very soon into the tour I put the gimbal away and used the Ulanzi for smooth video with a lightweight gadget. Cheaper and easier to use than a gimbal. Unfortunately I lost mine during my travels. I returned the gimbal, because it is difficult to use in a crowd.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great for 48hfp movies
customer_reviews.text: My family and I participate in the 48 Hour Film Project competitions and do several each year. We're low-budget and film using our iPhones; I have an old 6 plus and my nephew has a newer 7. I am extremely impressed by how much more stable the video is using this rig vs. just holding the phone carefully. The rig is made of thick plastic, and the gripper for holding the phone stretches quite a bit. I never felt like my phone was going to fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Pettigrew

customer_reviews.title: Good option for filming on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cellphone rig based on reviews I had seen, and it does not disappoint. I use it mainly on a tripod for filming YouTube videos, however I like having the option of using it without the tripod. It's very sturdy considering it's made of plastic. More so than I thought it would be. For someone just starting out and on a budget, I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S.

customer_reviews.title: Works like it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: I like the ability to have the lights, my phone and a mike all in the same place. It holds the phone very steady, but It doesn't allow good vision on the screen when setting it up. So you have to test a bit so you can know where the frame begins and ends. Would have been a five star if not for this.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Good rig but has some big drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty nice rig but two big drawbacks, one a glaring design flaw. The whole unit is plastic and the hot shoe slots are pretty thin and flimsy. The biggest issue I have, that actually lead me to another product, was that the foam bumpers that hold the smartphone in place are too narrow to use a smartphone in a protective phone case. After tightening the phone in place, it just falls out because the foam bumpers are just to narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Lucero

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid setup for photo and video
customer_reviews.text: Nice rig that feels good to use and is steady and versatile. I have a small complaint with the clamp... it doesn't really bite down on a thicker case. I have to remove my case to use my phone with it, but otherwise it is a solid cost effective base for a vlogging and photography setup.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Saetta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect after a minor modification
customer_reviews.text: I have an iPhone 11 Pro Max with a Moment Photo Case. The phone with case would not fit securely until I removed the red rectangular pad on the verticle part of the camera grip (This can be seen in the 2nd illustration in the above item description). After removing the pad, the phone was able to seat fully in the jaws. I find that this rig enables me to hold the phone much steadier than with the single handle mount that I had been using previously. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Russ M

customer_reviews.title: Great for all phones.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something for my phone. My iPhone. It has slots for attachments for lights on top or microphone. I’ve attached lights and they are stable and work great on top. My new iPhone fits in the spring holder. It has rubber on both sides so it doesn’t scratch the phone and I don’t have to take the cover off
customer_reviews.author: cameragirl

customer_reviews.title: Use this for everything!
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed with how much this setup can have on it. I attached my takstar sgc-598 microphone and my Neewer LED light and it looks amazing together. It holds my phone perfectly when I’m using it to make my baking videos, review videos and conference videos. It can be held by another person to record for you or attached to a tripod like the UBeesize tripod you see here. I can’t recommend this enough for those looking to get a sturdy hold on their video adventures!
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: This Is A Decent Smartphone Rig
customer_reviews.text: I’m satisfied with this smartphone camera rig. It fits well with Samsung Galaxy S7 but not when the wallet case of the smartphone is on but it fits with other slim cases on the Galaxy S7. It is much easier without the case for filming. For the money this rig is worth it but they could have thrown in some free accessories too.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, but doesn't compensate for phones with cases.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Galaxy 9+ with a modest protection case and this will NOT hold that phone stable in the spring mount vice. If I take the case off, then it works just fine. Well who really wants to do that all the time. Nice idea, but I don't think they thought it through enough.
customer_reviews.author: Dangerfield_BG

customer_reviews.title: Holds Phones Tightly (adjustable)
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic. I have a Samsung S8 and it works well. The phone, no phone will fall out if you lock the phone in place by properly twisting the knob on the back. That knob loosens and tightens the grip of the phone. The ability for attachments really makes this well made product exciting. I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalin A.

customer_reviews.title: Best mobile smart phone holder for action
customer_reviews.text: Best portable smart phone camera holder for when a tripod just won’t do. Stability and smooth functions for pan tilt and tracking. Best for action sports rough terrain and mobility to follow the action. Adds real cinematic flare to your phone videos for pennies.
customer_reviews.author: Mcconn 318

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. You can attach so much junk to it it's amazing. The plastic is cheap-and-cheesy looking, but, once you get all your stuff on it you realize it's a great tool to have. The only thing is you have to take your phone out of the case otherwise it's tough to clamp on.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: You need to remove your phone case...
customer_reviews.text: My Samsung S10 with a case is not fit well in that clamp. It barely holds the phone. Eather you have to remove the phone cover or modify the clamp. So, I decided to remove the red rubber pad and cut off the clamp edges. This is not a well thought out design. I would not recommend those who want to keep the phone case.
customer_reviews.author: jkim

customer_reviews.title: A great accessory for phone-filming!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little item for the price! Easy to attach your phone and all your video add-ons, helps with handling and stabilization, light and fairly compact. Please keep in mind that its plastic, not metal, so you have to be careful how you store and pack it for trips. But its a minor tradeoff for the price and light weight!
customer_reviews.author: Hope L Hatton

customer_reviews.title: Makes videoing from your phone so easy.
customer_reviews.text: Really good little rig for your phone. Makes adding lights and microphone easy. It is very versatile and easy to use. A great buy. Only drawback is you must remove the phone from the case to use it. Not a big hassle though. Worth it for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Marlo M

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great rig for the price. Im able to mount my mic and phone and it helps when shooting video. It adds some stability to the video and makes them look more professional. Sure its plastic, but its lightweight and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Susan W.

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for the job!
customer_reviews.text: Needed this rig for home movies and this is perfect. Holds a small shotgun mic, several small light pods and my cellphone securely. A trip to my local hardware store and I found mount screws that match the rig for custom mounts. Overall a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: LeilaM

customer_reviews.title: Good for simple vidoes
customer_reviews.text: Plastic feels a little flimsy compared to my metal DSLR cage, but the cage does work great. Obviously it's not gimbal levels of stabilization but it's better than handheld. My only worry is the long term durability.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product, can be used for different sizes of ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product, can be used for different sizes of smartphones, landscape or vertical, has three cold shoes to add lights, mics or whatever, and includes various thread holes to attach to a tripod or mono pod. It definitely improves the stabilization of your video or photo and seems to be very well built, very good material.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: great with gorilla tripod and watching YouTube in bed smile
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with the Huawei P30 pro cell phone, for doing telephoto 50 times photography.... I haven't tested this cage yet for Photography. BUT I found it's great For watching YouTube in Bed smile!.
customer_reviews.author: wantwhatwhy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent for use with older model phones
customer_reviews.text: I like the price. The adjustable mounting clamp ledges could be a bit more deeper to accommodate phones with Otterboxes and other slightly bulkier phone protectors. Since I’m using it with an old iPhone 5 for video interviews and filming classroom lectures it works fine with my older phone.
customer_reviews.author: BrendaLearns

customer_reviews.title: Great at first but failed after several uses.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my daughter for Christmas last year. At first it worked great and she loved it for her iPhone XS in the case no doubt. She used it about a dozen times and now it has failed. The screw mounts are broken and it is useless at this point. I would have to say over all this was a bad purchase. It is not a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Just save up your money for better
customer_reviews.text: I am not super impressed. The plastic is thin and brittle. Mine actually cracked along the top between mounts. I was excited to use this but I should have just saved for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Ryddle

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to video-record with my iphone X. It holds the phone stable and fits into my tripod with no issues. With a case on the phone, the phone could be squeezed out if the nut is tightened too much. Otherwise, it holds it perfectly and is very stable - I do keep my phone in a case. It's made of plastic, but is pretty solid. I haven't used any of the mounts for lights or mics yet, but imagine it would hold them just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Melnychuk

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Versatile.
customer_reviews.text: This rig does a good job in handling your phone and/or cameras. There are plenty of spots & holes to mount something on, like a filming light or a microphone, or even another camera. The phone grip is also good at holding any size phone, even one still in a protective case. I would highly recommend this rig for any aspiring filmmakers/photographers who need a hand in stability.
customer_reviews.author: Hank the Driver

customer_reviews.title: Works as claimed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use for phone, mic and lights. You do need to be careful when mounting to a tripod. I tightened it just a little too tight and broke my first one. Second one I'm more careful with and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Grabow

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect !!
customer_reviews.text: Nice gadget, I use for video recording when I need stability. I have a Gimbal but this works for certain applications a little easier. Worth the price and I use regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price but something other than plastic would be nice
customer_reviews.text: This rig is pretty versatile for throwing in your phone and shooting some videos. Great for the price but for a few bucks more, an aluminum or partial aluminum rig would look pretty slick.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetGeek

customer_reviews.title: Top 4 Amazon Items to start Youtube/Photography/Filming
customer_reviews.text: Great item and one of my top items to start filming or photography. The Rig holds very well for being a plastic mold and holds the extra attachments very sturdy. I use it all the time and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Rell Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Stable and easy
customer_reviews.text: this was a great buy. I may be using this more than my gimble for quick shoots. one suggestion would be to have the phone at the top of the box not the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Larger iPhones fir perfectly
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this for recording unboxing videos using my iPhone 7S. It interfaces beautifully with my tripod (an older, lightweight aluminum tripod) and the connections are simple and direct. The spring-loaded phone grip uses soft jaws to avoid marring the surface of the phone, and in short, it just works.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Professional and smooth videos !
customer_reviews.text: The weight and size of this product is perfect for on the go situations where you want to record but not have to worry about the video coming out shaky or slanted. It keeps the phone nice and positioned within the center to give very aligned and smooth recording. I use it for my gym videos especially and everyone always asks where I the stabilizer from and how they wish they had something like that to record gym videos with. Great product !
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Allen

customer_reviews.title: XS MAX BEWARE smaller phones are ok though.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty strong and will fit most any phone video recording needs however if you have an XS MAX this will only fit your phone without a case and even then it will be a tight squeeze. The top side of the griping mechanism does not extend to the end of the track leaving barely enough room to fit larger phones without a case.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad

customer_reviews.title: I love how it helps stabilize my hands when holding free-handing ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple and very effective device for iPhone videography. I love how it helps stabilize my hands when holding free-handing it, and how it easily attaches to my tripod with fittings for lights, etc. Great product at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Funderburk

customer_reviews.title: Has Held Up Well
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this quite a bit for months now and it has done very well! I thought the plastic might break at some point but it has been surprisingly sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Shaky Hands.
customer_reviews.text: I have very shakey hands and this worked perfectly for stabilizing my videos. Being able to hold with both hands and firm grip makes it take less time to edit. Having the additional slots for add ins like a light and mic was a wonderful bonus.
customer_reviews.author: GeekTechMedia

customer_reviews.title: life saver
customer_reviews.text: I use this very often for live facebook videos, music videos, and youtube videos. It will fit and tripod eit standard tripod screws.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan C. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Works well but iPhone fits too snug
customer_reviews.text: Great concept and it works as described but if you have a larger iPhone it is hard to get in and out of this clip I docked a star for this.
customer_reviews.author: Monica tells it like it is

customer_reviews.title: The beat one yet
customer_reviews.text: I just returned another similar product. "Horrible". This one ticks all of my boxes, well made, easy to use, THREE Cold Shoes, & FOUR tripod mounting thread, light weight. Love It.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Handy, lightweight, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Makes shooting with my iPhone a breeze! Helps stabilize the video, and there’s plenty of cold-shoe spots for attachments.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Great rig and very affordable
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the Ulanzi rig. I got it for my iPhone 8 to explore smartphone videography. I use FilmicPro and the rig provides good stability. It is pretty versatile, I have added a few extra accessories like lights, a bubble level (if I use it with a tripod), and a mic. If you use a little bit of MacGyver wisdom, you can do great things with this inexpensive yet very good rig.
customer_reviews.author: Prudencio IV Martinez

customer_reviews.title: On time & very sturdy. The metal version isn't needed.
customer_reviews.text: So far sturdy product. Fits my s10 plus with case no issues. I can't wait to start shooting videos with the kids on my tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Carmichael

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Two stars. One for coming on time, second one for at least being the correct item. Missing last three as it came broke.
customer_reviews.author: D.Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: like it
customer_reviews.text: works great, holds the phone for snapping videos and photos. easy to mount the phone in it and toat it along
customer_reviews.author: willett

customer_reviews.title: Great rig for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It’s plastic. But it’s lightweight. I have an iPhone X and it fits even with my bulky Ballistic Tungsten case. However, I usually use it with the Spigen thin fit. Also enough room for the Neewer 37mm ND clip on filter.
customer_reviews.author: EmceeGraffiti

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I first received word of this product after doing a mobile filmmaking workshop through SAG/AFTRA. This Venyn product was ranked number 1 for stabilizing rigs. I couldn't agree more. You have the ability to attach lighting kits, mics, tripods, which makes the rig very versatile. It is stable but lightweight. It is easy to hold but most importantly easy to use. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great for YouTubing at home
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive and versatile part of my video kit. great for setting up a rig with lights and microphone on a tripod at home, but also for stabilizing handheld shots off the tripod
customer_reviews.author: sadelack

customer_reviews.title: DOES THE JOB
customer_reviews.text: All plastic and so not good for professional, everyday use, etc. But works fine for YouTubers like me who want a low-cost solution.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Cheap made!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it's made really cheap. My equipment has a hard time attaching as well. Makes it very top heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Piper Paisley

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit cell phone cases
customer_reviews.text: I like this very much other than the fact that I have to remove my phone from the case to you it. I would have expected larger grips to accommodate most generic cases then this would have been wonderful. Now it’s a cumbersome process to remove from case and back.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: Far sturdier than you'd ever imagine
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the gate, and I just got the thing, it seems much more sturdy than the price would lead you to believe.
